item.title: Estimating the Perceived 'Claustrophobia' of New York City's Streets (2024)
item.description:
Methodology - Bringing in Clutter For this computational analysis, ‘clutter’ is anything that takes up space on the sidewalk. We assign points to different clutters with spatial joins. Since some clutters have non-uniform sizes (for example, there are several different configurations of bus stops, each with a different size), and size data was unavailable for some clutter types, we stick with the naive approach for now.

Read more

item.title: US declines to join more than 70 countries in signing UN cybercrime treaty
item.description:
Waly said the convention would be a “vital tool” that will ensure “a safer digital world for all. Human rights groups warned on Friday that it effectively forces member states to create a broad electronic surveillance dragnet that would include crimes that have nothing to do with technology. Countries have only recently begun to share digital evidence across borders but the convention would increase that practice.

Read more

item.title: Replacing EBS and Rethinking Postgres Storage from First Principles
item.description:
It’s storage that looks like a local disk but scales like a cloud service. Storage that behaves more like software than hardware. Traditional storage can’t keep up with that pace or economics.

Read more

item.title: 3D solar tower increases capacity factor 50%, triples solar surface area
item.description:
3D solar tower increases capacity factor 50%, triples solar surface area Janta Power closed $5. The company said its solar tower has a capacity factor 50% greater than traditional solar installations. While typical flat installations have a capacity factor of about 22%, Janta Power said its typical installations achieve a capacity factor of about 32%.

Read more

item.title: The International Criminal Court wants to become independent of USA technology
item.description:
The International Criminal Court (ICC) wants to become independent of technology from the USA – for fear of reprisals from Donald Trump, Handelsblatt has learned. Furthermore, the US government in Washington is examining further measures against the International Criminal Court, Handelsblatt further reports. However, Handelsblatt sees this as an indication that geopolitics is increasingly revolving around technology.

Read more
